skill.name: Email Composer
skill.description: Draft professional emails for various contexts including business, technical, and customer communication. Use when the user needs help writing emails or composing professional messages.
skill.summary: Draft professional emails for various contexts including business, technical, and customer communica...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation, email templates, and best practice guidelines. No executable code, file system access, network calls, environment variables, or command execution capabilities were detected. The skill's purpose and behavior are fully aligned.

content.value_statement: Writing professional emails takes time and skill. This skill provides templates, guidelines, and best practices for composing effective business emails for any context, from requests to follow-ups to customer support.
actual_capabilities: Draft business emails for various contexts including requests, announcements, and follow-ups
Create technical update emails with clear maintenance and deployment information
Compose customer support responses that address issues professionally
Generate meeting request emails with clear agendas and availability options
Apply appropriate tone and formality based on recipient relationship
Write email templates for apology, decline, and good news scenarios
limitations: Does not send or deliver emails - only generates email content
Does not access email clients or calendar systems
Cannot verify recipient information or email addresses
Does not integrate with email services like Gmail or Outlook

use_cases.title: Business correspondence
use_cases.description: Draft professional emails for colleagues, managers, and vendors with proper tone and structure.

use_cases.title: Customer response templates
use_cases.description: Create consistent, empathetic responses to customer inquiries and issue resolution.

use_cases.title: Technical notifications
use_cases.description: Compose maintenance announcements, deployment updates, and technical status communications.

prompt_templates.title: Simple request
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a professional email requesting information about [topic] from [recipient]. Include these key points: [list points]. Use a [formal/casual] tone.

prompt_templates.title: Follow-up
prompt_templates.prompt: Compose a polite follow-up email regarding [original topic] sent on [date]. The purpose is to [purpose]. Keep it brief and non-pressuring.

prompt_templates.title: Announcement
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft an announcement email about [announcement topic]. Include: [key details]. Target audience is [audience]. Use an [exciting/professional/urgent] tone.

prompt_templates.title: Full context
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a professional email with full context. Purpose: [request/announcement/inquiry]. Recipient: [relationship]. Key points to cover: [list]. Desired tone: [formal/casual/urgent]. Include call to action: [action].

output_examples.input: Write a follow-up email to a vendor about a proposal I sent last week regarding new software implementation.
output: Subject: Following up: Software implementation proposal
I wanted to follow up on the software implementation proposal I sent last week. I understand you're busy, so I wanted to make sure it didn't get lost in your inbox.
To recap, the proposed solution would:
- Integrate with our existing CRM system
I'd be happy to schedule a brief call to discuss any questions you might have.
Looking forward to hearing from you.

best_practices: Always include a clear, specific subject line that summarizes the email purpose
State your purpose in the opening paragraph to respect the reader's time
Use bullet points to organize multiple items or questions for easy scanning
anti_patterns: Using vague subject lines like 'Update' or 'Question' that provide no context
Starting with long paragraphs of background before stating the main purpose
Marking every email as urgent, which reduces the impact when a truly urgent message arrives

faq.question: Can this skill send emails directly?
faq.answer: No. The skill generates email content that you can copy and paste into your email client.

faq.question: What email providers are supported?
faq.answer: The skill works with any email client. It generates text content only, without integration.

faq.question: Does the skill access my email history?
faq.answer: No. The skill does not read emails or access any external data sources.

faq.question: How many email templates are included?
faq.answer: The skill includes templates for requests, follow-ups, technical updates, customer support, meetings, declines, apologies, and announcements.

faq.question: Can I customize the templates?
faq.answer: Yes. Templates are starting points that you can modify with your specific details, tone, and context.

faq.question: How is this different from using Claude directly?
faq.answer: The skill provides structured guidance, proven templates, and best practices specifically designed for professional email communication.
